The most unhealthy mechanic? Suppression, by far. Long duration CC, generally unavoidable, and sitting there waiting to start doing things again isn't fun gameplay.

Champions with the mechanic:
Yasuo - Last Breath (AOE 2 second suppress from a ridiculous range, can be triggered by ally skills or even Baron Nashor)

Tahm Kench - Devour (Suppress your allies! Makes the champion untargetable so your allies can't pile damage on, but does lots of damage on its own. Point and click)

Warwick - Infinite Duress (Applies Devourer, BoRK, Nashor's, Wit's End and Titanic Hydra 5 times, point and click)

Skarner - Impale (Low damage but allows you to be swiftly repositioned, giving Skarner immense MS while he's suppressing you to do so. Point and click)

Malzahar - Nether Grasp (High damage, long duration, allows him to easily lock you into both his DoTs plus Liandry's. Point and click)

My number one unhealthy mechanic %hp true damage

There is no interaction with it at all. No counterplay nothing it gets applied and you just going to have to deal with it period.

I can understand true damage as a flat amount on powerfull spells adequate cost be it cooldown mana etc. But not too much of it in the game. It has been getting more and more abundant which is bad.

Stealth is the runner up, not ebcause its always op, This depends on other factors of a champion too. But it is fucking annoying to deal with especially now that vision has been gutted, well at least the measn of detecting stealth by removing pink trinket.

A good third is hyper mobility, you know like Riven has, it removes strategic thinking and decision making. Its pretty much i go ham when i please and if it doesnt work out well then ill just gtfo. It pretty much puts all other champions in a reactive position. For example, Shen has balanced mobility, Riven does not. Low cooldown on 4 dashes  it makes it so only you decide when a fight happens meaning you can always opt out of it but the opponent never can. If you have any decent game knowledge and skill this allows you to pretty much only fight in your favor.

Crit... I know this will never ever happen, but I honestly wish crit was just removed from the game. I've lost many fights, and potentially games, due to the enemy adc getting luckier than mine.. And I'm aware that I've also won probably just as many fights and maybe games for the same reason, but I never feel good about winning those when I know I just got luckier that time. This is supposed to be a game with a balance of strategy and skill, and I see crit as neither of those unless you build 100% of it.
